intro: Tetranthera salicifolia var. elongata, commonly known as the elongated willow-leaf tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its elongated, willow-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It often grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
